CatDescriptText: Mr. Dan Firestein, steel worker, Lebanon and Mr. Jim Colosimo, railroad foreman, Uptown, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, September 16, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think that political party policy makers respect the Negro vote and act accordingly, or do they take it for granted?  Why?" Mr. Firestein's answer reads: "I don't think that it is taken for granted.  I think they continue with actions for which the groundwork was already laid." Mr. Colosimo's answer reads: "I think they respect it and act accordingly, because of the large vote."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Dan Firestein wearing gabardine suit jacket and medallion patterned necktie, standing in front of C.C. Mellor store, Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of Jim Colosimo wearing short sleeved collared shirt, standing in front of Sherwin Williams, Smithfield Street, Downtown
